title-group.article-title: Metaphysics and Comparative Philosophy: A Discussion of Metaphysics in light of Robert C. Neville's Epistemology

ref.mixed-citation: Neville's position is developed throughout the five volumes noted. He also presents a more condensed version of the argument in an article titled, "On the Relation of Christian to Other Philosophies." It appeared in a 1986 volume titled, Being and Truth: Essays in Honor of John Macquarrie.
Recovery of the Measure (1989)
Whitehead, see Process and Reality ([1929] 1978, part 3)
Dewey's best statements on this are in Experience and Nature ([1925] 1958, chap. 4, especially pp. 128-29).
Neville 1989,44-47

Neville criticizes the hermeneutical movements for allowing their discovery to cut us off from a viable understanding of "truth" and the world. In Recovery of the Measure, he says, "None of the intellectual projects feeding our current preoccupation with interpretation sustains a developed philosophy of nature— As a result, these European and Anglo-Ameri- can approaches lose the world, whatever their own insights. They lose their grip on a sense of reality by which we would hope that our interpretations could be measured" (1989,1).
Hans-Georg Gadamer, Truth and Method (1975)
Paul Ricoeur, The Conflict of Interpre- tations (1974).
Neville's discussion of Peirce's semiotics in chapter 4, pages 71-87.
Neville shares with Dewey and Whitehead (see 1989, chaps. 9 and 10, pp. 167-201).
The Reconstruction of Thinking (1982, 38-42)
The Tao and The Daimon (1981, 58-61)
The Highroad around Modernism (1992, 111-59).
Neville's citation of Peirce is from The Collected Papers of Charles Sanders Peirce (1935), paragraphs 446-50 and 505-6.
Dewey, John. [1925] 1958. Experience and Nature. New York: Dover.
Gadamer, Hans-Georg. 1975. Truth and Method. Ed. Garrett Barden and John Cumming. New York: Seabury Press.
Kuhn, Thomas. 1962. The Structure of Scientific Revolutions. Chicago: University of Chi- cago Press.
Neville, Robert C. 1981. The Reconstruction of Thinking. Albany, N.Y.: SUNY Press.
-. 1982. The Tao and The Daimon: Segments of a Religious Inquiry. Albany, N.Y.: SUNY Press.
-. 1986a. "A Thesis Concerning Truth." Process Studies 15: 127-36.
-. 1986b. "On the Relation of Christian to Other Philosophies." In Being and Truth: Essays in Honor of John Macquarrie, ed. Alistaire Kee and Eugen T. Long, 276-92. Lon- don: SLM Press.
-. 1989. Recovery of the Measure: Interpretation and Nature. Albany, N.Y.: SUNY Press.
-. 1991. Behind the Masks of God: An Essay toward Comparative Theology. Albany, N.Y.: SUNY Press.
-. 1992. The Highroad around Modernism. Albany, N.Y.: SUNY Press.
Peirce, Charles Sanders. 1935. The Collected Papers, vol 5. Ed. Charles Hartshorne and Paul Weiss. Cambridge: Harvard University Press.
Ricoeur, Paul. 1974. The Conflict of Interpretations: Essays in Hermeneutics. Ed. Don Ihde. Evanston: Northwestern University Press.
Taylor, Mark. 1987. Alterity. Chicago: The University of Chicago Press.
Whitehead, Alfred North. [1929] 1978. Process and Reality: An Essay in Cosmology, cor- rected ed. Ed. David Ray Griffin and Donald W. Sherburne. New York: The Free Press.
